pages.text: Arambourgiania was a massive azhdarchid pterosaur from the Late Cretaceous of Jordan. With an estimated wingspan of 10-11 meters, it was one of the largest flying animals ever known. Its most distinctive feature was its extremely long neck, which could reach up to 3 meters in length. The creature likely used its height and long neck to hunt prey from a giraffe-like stance, feeding on small animals and possibly young dinosaurs.

Imagine a flying giraffe with wings the size of a small plane - that's basically what this absolute unit was! While not technically a dinosaur (it's a pterosaur), this sky giant would definitely make you look twice if it flew overhead.
